revised_title: Topography and Topology in Solid-State Chemistry: Advances and Applications
tldr: This article discusses the impact of topological concepts on solid-state chemistry, focusing on topochemical control, crystal engineering, and the role of defects in organic and inorganic solids. The author highlights the importance of these concepts in understanding and advancing various fields, including organic solid-state chemistry, polymer science, and the synthesis of chiral molecules under abiotic conditions.
